title: E-Textile-Based Computational Creativity Workshop: STEAM Integrated Education

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental electrical circuit theory and comprehension of computing concepts
context.additional_context: Practice-centered workshop for strengthening mathematics-based computational thinking in bring-your-own-device (BYOD) environments. Exploring the balance between aesthetic elements and functional implementation while experiencing the convergence of traditional craft techniques and digital technologies

learning_goals: Solve at least three electrical circuit problems using series/parallel circuit designs in e-textile fabrication
Fabricate wearable devices applying mathematical algorithms (e.g., conditionals, loops) with sensors based on Arduino or micro:bit
Complete and receive peer evaluation for one or more e-textile prototypes combining functionality and aesthetic elements through design thinking

resources: E-Textile Kit (Conductive Thread, Sensors, LEDs, etc.)
Digital Fabrication Tools (3D Printer, Laser Cutter Shared Access)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
